strings.string: In the following step-by-step tutorial you learn how to program the behavior of Steve and his parcel. The images below show you how to control Steve during the game. You have to navigate Steve above the target and tap the background to drop the parcel. Good luck...
How to install Pocket Code on your mobile device.
How to download the essential program allowing you to program “Skydiving Steve”.
The variables x and y allow you to control the position of your parachute.
Label the x position of your parachute.
Label and set the y starting position of your parachute.
You need to control the position of your parachute at all times. Insert a "Forever" - loop to do so.
Add more bricks in your "Forever" loop to control your parachute. Inserting the variables x and y in your "Place at" brick enables you to control the position of your parachute.
Change the variable y by -3 to let your parachute glide to the ground. Change the variable x so your parachute follows the inclination angle of your mobile device.
You can control the height of your parachute with the loudness sensor of your mobile device. To do so, add and modify a "If 1 is true then" brick.
When you restart the game, the starting position of your parachute should match your initial starting position. For this you need to add and modify three bricks as shown in the pictures below.
You have now successfully finished your "parachute" object! Navigate back to the object overview to modify the next object.
Here you start modifying the object „target". Add the bricks to control the position and size of your target.
When you restart the game, the position of your target needs to change. For this step, set the variables goalx and goaly with the random function.
Modify your "Place at" brick to control the position of your target with the variables goalx an goaly.
Here you start modifying your object "parcel". When the object "parcel" receives the message "start", the parcel should be shown. Set the position of parcel with the variables x and y.
To check whether the parcel has hit the target, you need the "If 1 is true then" brick.
If the parcel has successfully hit the target, you need to modify the position of the parcel.Send a message to the other objects to let them know that you have won.
Here you modify the object “restart”. Define the position and the behavior of the object.
Complete the program by modifying the "background" object. Now you can start playing your game. Have fun!
Click on the images below to enlarge them. Review the scripts of your objects if your game doesn't work correctly.
Tap "Explore" in "Pocket Code" on your Mobile Device.
Pull down the menu and tap "Open Skydiving Steve".
Drag and drop the "Set variable" - brick below the "When program started" - brick.
Add a second variable just as before.
Drag and drop the "Forever" - brick below the "Set variable" - bricks.
Insert the shown bricks below the "Forever" - brick.
Tap "200" in the same brick on the top, go to the "Variables" category and choose "y". Confirm with "OK".
Change the value of the first "Set variable" - brick to "-3".
At the second "Set variable" - brick tap the field "0.0".
Check if your inserted formula matches the one in the screenshot and confirm with "OK".
Add a “If 1 is true then” - brick and place it below the last “Change variable” - brick.
Tap the field with the value "0" within the "If 1 is true then" - brick.
Check if your formula matches the formula in the screenshot and tap "OK".
Add a "Change variable" - brick and modify the value like above.
Place it below the last brick ("End of loop").
Tap the field filled with "message 1", choose "New…" and insert "restart".
Change the values of the two "Set variable" - bricks like shown in the screenshot above.
Tap the "back" - button on your device.
Now you should see this screen on your device.
Add and modify the bricks as in the screenshot above.
Add four more bricks like shown above.
Tap the field "0.0" and insert the formula "random(-400, 400)".
Repeat the steps 1-3 for the second "Set variable" - brick, expect naming the variable "goaly" and setting the value to "random(400, -700)".
Change the values of the "Place at" - brick to "goalx" and "goaly".
Check if your values match the ones above.
Go back until you see this screen.
Add all the bricks shown above.
Change the value of the "Set size" - brick to "50".
Tap the field "restart" within the "When I receive" - brick and create the new message: "start".
Change the values of the "Place at" - brick to "x" and "y".
Add the above shown bricks below the last "Place at" - brick.
Change the value within the "Change Y by" - brick to "-5". Then tap into the field "1" within the "If 1 is true then".
Insert the shown formula and tap "OK".
"position_x" and "position_y" can be found in the category "Object".
Change the values of the "Place at" - brick to "position_x" and "goaly+100".
Tap the field "Broadcast" and create a new message "win".
Add the above shown bricks and modify their values alike.
Go back until you see this screen on your device. Go to the scripts of the object "restart".
Add the above shown bricks and modify their values alike.
Add the above shown bricks and set the "Broadcast" - message to "restart".
Go back until you see this screen, then go to the scripts of “Background”.
Add the above shown bricks and set the "Broadcast" - message to "start".

You've successfully completed the tutorial "Skydiving Steve". We would be pleased to find some really cool remixes of "Skydiving Steve" on pocketcode.org --- just change it as you like and upload it again from your own account.
